definitions.definition: ( anatomy ) The portion of the upper human appendage , from the shoulder to the wrist and sometimes including the hand .
examples: She stood with her right arm extended and her palm forward to indicate “Stop!”

definitions.definition: ( anatomy ) The extended portion of the upper limb , from the shoulder to the elbow .
examples: The arm and forearm are parts of the upper limb in the human body.

definitions.definition: A limb , or locomotive or prehensile organ , of an invertebrate animal.
The part of a piece of clothing that covers the arm.

A long, narrow , more or less rigid part of an object extending from the main part or centre of the object, such as the armrest of an armchair , a crane , a pair of spectacles or a pair of compasses .
examples: The robot arm reached out and placed the part on the assembly line.

definitions.definition: ( geography ) A bay or inlet off a main body of water.
examples: Shelburne Bay is an arm of Lake Champlain.
the cavalry arm of the military service
The team needs to sign another arm in the offseason.

definitions.definition: ( genetics ) One of the two parts of a chromosome .
A group of patients in a medical trial.

main_definition: ( anatomy ) The portion of the upper human appendage , from the shoulder to the wrist and sometimes including the hand .

examples: The Duke's arms were a sable gryphon rampant on an argent field.

definitions.definition: War ; hostilities ; deeds or exploits of war. (Can we add an example for this sense?)

main_definition: ( usually used in the plural ) A weapon .
secondary_definitions: ( in the plural ) Heraldic bearings or insignia .
( in the plural , obsolete ) War ; hostilities ; deeds or exploits of war. (Can we add an example for this sense?)
